1.text: Be therefore imitators of God, as beloved children.

2.text: Walk in love, even as Christ also loved you, and gave himself up for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling fragrance.

3.text: But sexual immorality, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be mentioned among you, as becomes saints;

4.text: nor filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not appropriate; but rather giving of thanks.

5.text: Know this for sure, that no sexually immoral person, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the Kingdom of Christ and God.

6.text: Let no one deceive you with empty words. For because of these things, the wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience.

7.text: Therefore don’t be partakers with them.

8.text: For you were once darkness, but are now light in the Lord. Walk as children of light,

9.text: for the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth,

10.text: proving what is well pleasing to the Lord.

11.text: Have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather even reprove them.

12.text: For the things which are done by them in secret, it is a shame even to speak of.

13.text: But all things, when they are reproved, are revealed by the light, for everything that reveals is light.

14.text: Therefore he says, “Awake, you who sleep, and arise from the dead, and Christ will shine on you.”

15.text: Therefore watch carefully how you walk, not as unwise, but as wise;

16.text: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

17.text: Therefore don’t be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.

18.text: Don’t be drunken with wine, in which is dissipation, but be filled with the Spirit,

19.text: speaking to one another in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs; singing, and making melody in your heart to the Lord;

20.text: giving thanks always concerning all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God, even the Father;

21.text: subjecting yourselves one to another in the fear of Christ.

22.text: Wives, be subject to your own husbands, as to the Lord.

23.text: For the husband is the head of the wife, and Christ also is the head of the assembly, being himself the savior of the body.

24.text: But as the assembly is subject to Christ, so let the wives also be to their own husbands in everything.

25.text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the assembly, and gave himself up for it;

26.text: that he might sanctify it, having cleansed it by the washing of water with the word,

27.text: that he might present the assembly to himself gloriously, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

28.text: Even so husbands also ought to love their own wives as their own bodies. He who loves his own wife loves himself.

29.text: For no man ever hated his own flesh; but nourishes and cherishes it, even as the Lord also does the assembly;

30.text: because we are members of his body, of his flesh and bones.

31.text: “For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will be joined to his wife. The two will become one flesh.”

32.text: This mystery is great, but I speak concerning Christ and of the assembly.

33.text: Nevertheless each of you must also love his own wife even as himself; and let the wife see that she respects her husband.
